title: Sydney Sweeney
content:
{{short description|American actress (born 1997)}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=August 2020}}
{{Infobox person
| name               = Sydney Sweeney
| image              = Sydney Sweeney 2019 by Glenn Francis.jpg
| alt                = <!-- descriptive text for use by speech synthesis (text-to-speech) software -->
| caption            = Sweeney in 2019
| birth_name         = Sydney Bernice Sweeney
| birth_date         = {{Birth date and age|1997|09|12}}
| birth_place        = [[Spokane, Washington]], U.S.
| occupation         = Actress
| years_active       = 2009–present
| partner            = Jonathan Davino (engaged)
| signature          = Sydney Sweeney signature.svg
}}
'''Sydney Bernice Sweeney''' (born September 12, 1997)<ref name=UPI>{{cite news|url= https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |title= UPI Almanac for Thursday, Sept. 12, 2019 |work=[[United Press International]]|date= September 12, 2019|accessdate=September 9, 2020 | archive-date= September 5, 2020 |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20191205204919/https://www.upi.com/Top_News/2019/09/12/UPI-Almanac-for-Thursday-Sept-12-2019/9881568078426/ |url-status=live|quote=…actor Sydney Sweeney in 1997 (age 22)}}</ref> is an American actress. She first gained attention for appearing in the television series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'' (2018), ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'' (2018), and ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'' (2018). In 2019, she featured in [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s film ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]''.

Sweeney has starred as [[List of Euphoria characters#Cassandra "Cassie" Howard|Cassie Howard]] in the HBO teen drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]]'' since 2019 and played a sardonic teenager in ''[[The White Lotus]]'' in 2021. For her roles in them, Sweeney received two [[Primetime Emmy Awards]] nominations in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]], the former for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series|Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] and the latter for [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie|Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Drama Series - 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=July 12, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220712154223/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-drama-series |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Emmy Awards |date=July 12, 2022 |title=Outstanding Supporting Actress In A Limited Or Anthology Series Or Movie - 2022 |url=https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |access-date=July 12, 2022 |website=[[Academy of Television Arts & Sciences|Television Academy]] |archive-date=September 22, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220922031924/https://www.emmys.com/awards/nominees-winners/2022/outstanding-supporting-actress-in-a-miniseries-or-a-movie |url-status=live }}</ref>

==Early life==
Sweeney was born on September 12, 1997, in [[Spokane, Washington]], to Lisa ({{Nee}} Mudd) and Steven Sweeney. Her mother is a lawyer and her father works in the medical field.<ref name="coveteur" /> She has a brother, Trent.<ref name="chicago" /> Sweeney was raised in northwestern [[Idaho]]<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Elle (magazine)|Elle]]|url=https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|title=Sydney Sweeney On Defying Expectations, Ambition And Launching Her Own Production Company|last=Burgum|first=Becky|date=February 8, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220209082649/https://www.elle.com/uk/life-and-culture/culture/a39008740/sydney-sweeney-euphoria-defying-expectations/|archive-date=February 9, 2022}}</ref> in the state's [[Idaho Panhandle|Panhandle region]] along the Washington border, at a rural lakeside home that her family has inhabited for five generations.<ref name=courier>{{cite news|url=https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|work=[[Bristol Herald Courier]]|title=Sydney Sweeney's road to stardom 'was not happy'|date=January 24, 2022|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220221041827/https://heraldcourier.com/article_0a4f88dd-004f-5371-a742-0edad1c3eb9c.html|archive-date=February 21, 2022}}</ref> Sweeney has said she has a "religious family".<ref>{{Cite web |last=Tinnin |first=Drew |date=2018-08-14 |title=Interview: Sydney Sweeney on ALONG CAME THE DEVIL and UNDER THE SILVER LAKE |url=https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |access-date=2022-07-29 |website=Dread Central |language=en-US |archive-date=July 29, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220729033554/https://www.dreadcentral.com/news/280867/interview-sydney-sweeney-on-along-came-the-devil-and-under-the-silver-lake/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney attended [[Saint George's School (Spokane, Washington)|Saint George's School]] in Spokane.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020">{{cite news|url=https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|title=Actress Sydney Sweeney returns home to Spokane for fan visit at middle school|first=Emma|last= Epperly|newspaper=[[The Spokesman-Review]]|location=Spokane, Washington|date=February 3, 2020|accessdate=September 9, 2020|archive-date=June 27, 2020|archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20200627123326/https://www.spokesman.com/stories/2020/feb/03/actress-sydney-sweeney-return-home-to-spokane-for-/|url-status=live}}</ref> She was active in numerous athletics: "I was in every single sport possible", she said. "I was on the soccer team, the baseball team, the [[Slalom skiing|snow slalom ski]] team, I was wakeboarding."<ref name=courier/> Sweeney also studied multiple languages and graduated with top grades.<ref name="Interview with Hollywood reporter">{{Cite web|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|title=Sydney Sweeney on Fame, Hollywood Fakery and the Pressure of Paying the Bills|last=RANKIN|first=SEIJA|date=July 27, 2022|website=Hollywood Reporter|language=en-US|access-date=July 27, 2022|archive-date=July 27, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220727142756/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/tv/tv-features/sydney-sweeney-fame-emmys-euphoria-the-white-lotus-1235186681/|url-status=live}}</ref> She became interested in acting after auditioning to be an extra in an independent film that was shooting in the Spokane area.<ref name="Spokesman-review 02-03-2020" /> To convince her parents to allow her to pursue acting, she presented them with a five-year [[business plan]].<ref name="coveteur" /> Sweeney began to audition and book commercial acting jobs in [[Seattle]] and [[Portland, Oregon]], where the family temporarily resided, until choosing to relocate to [[Los Angeles]] when she was 14 years old.<ref>{{cite interview|last=Sweeney|first=Sydney|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|via=YouTube|series=AOL Build Series|title=Sydney Sweeney Talks About The HBO Series, "Euphoria"|date=June 24, 2019|time=2:30|access-date=January 21, 2022|archive-date=January 21, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220121170955/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mCveID9lSFE|url-status=live}}</ref>

== Personal life ==
Sweeney has been engaged to her longtime boyfriend, Chicago-based restaurateur Jonathan Davino, since February 2022.<ref>{{cite news |last=Selleck |first=Emily |date=March 2, 2022 |title='Euphoria' star Sydney Sweeney engaged to Jonathan Davino |work=[[Page Six]] |url=https://pagesix.com/2022/03/02/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-engaged-to-jonathan-davino/ |url-status=live |access-date=March 2, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220302232739/https://pagesix.com/2022/03/02/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-engaged-to-jonathan-davino/ |archive-date=March 2, 2022}}</ref> Davino is heir to the city’s storied pizza restaurant Pompei, which opened in Chicago in 1909.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Garcia |first=Gretty |date=2022-05-10 |title=FYI, Here’s Everything You Need to Know About Sydney Sweeney’s Fiancé Jonathan Davino |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a39813919/who-is-sydney-sweeney-boyfriend-jonathan-davino/ |access-date=2022-12-11 |website=Cosmopolitan |language=en-US}}</ref>

Sweeney trains in [[mixed martial arts]], and competed in [[grappling]] in high school.<ref name="marieclarie" /><ref name="chicago" /> Sweeney owns a 1969 [[Ford Bronco]], which she detailed its restoration on her [[TikTok]] account.<ref>[https://harpersbazaar.com.au/sydney-sweeney-car-repair-tiktok/ 'You can do anything you set your mind to': Sydney Sweeney’s sweet message for young girls interested in cars], Harper's Bazaar, April 2022</ref>

==Career==
===Early work===
Sweeney began her career as guest star in TV shows such as ''[[90210 (TV series)|90210]]'', ''[[Criminal Minds]]'', ''[[Grey's Anatomy]]'' and ''[[Pretty Little Liars]]''.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-cassie-on-euphoria-sydney-sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |title=You'll Recognize This 'Euphoria' Star From Some Of Your Favorite Shows |last=Grubbs |first=Jefferson |date=June 16, 2019 |magazine=[[Bustle (magazine)|Bustle]] |accessdate=July 3, 2019 |archive-date=June 17, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190617124555/https://www.bustle.com/p/who-plays-cassie-on-euphoria-sydney-sweeney-has-had-a-major-few-years-17998527 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref name="variety" />

Sweeney starred as Emaline Addario on the [[Netflix]] series ''[[Everything Sucks!]]'', which revolved around two groups of [[High school (North America)|high school]] students in Oregon in 1996. She then appeared in the [[HBO]] miniseries ''[[Sharp Objects (miniseries)|Sharp Objects]]'', recurring as Alice, a roommate whom [[Amy Adams]]'s character meets at a [[psychiatric hospital|psychiatric facility]].<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="deadline" /> Her character was originally supposed to have a smaller role, but the director kept bringing her in for more scenes.<ref name="harpers" /> For the role, Sweeney studied stories of girls who suffered from [[mental disorder|mental illness]] and [[self-harm]]ing, and visited hospitals who had patients who self-harmed.<ref name="thelast" /><ref name="harpers" /> She filmed ''Everything Sucks!'' and ''Sharp Objects'' concurrently, the former during the week and latter on weekends.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |title='Sharp Objects' Star Sydney Sweeney Thanks Fans Who Say They "Hate" Her |last=Song |first=Sandar |date=July 9, 2018 |magazine=[[Nylon (magazine)|Nylon]] |accessdate=June 25, 2019 |archive-date=June 23, 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190623232446/https://nylon.com/articles/sharp-objects-sydney-sweeney-interview |url-status=live }}</ref>

Sweeney had a role in the thriller film ''[[Under the Silver Lake]]'' in 2018.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Gillespie|first1=Katherine|url=https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|title="Euphoria" Breakout Sydney Sweeney Shot by Cole Sprouse|work=[[Paper (magazine)|Paper]]|date=April 9, 2020|accessdate=September 12, 2020|archive-date=October 15, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201015004956/https://www.papermag.com/sydney-sweeney-cole-sprouse-2645672546.html?rebelltitem=1#rebelltitem1|url-status=live}}</ref> She had a recurring role during the second season of the dystopian drama series ''[[The Handmaid's Tale (TV series)|The Handmaid's Tale]]'' as Eden Spencer, a pious and obedient girl from the totalitarian Republic of Gilead.<ref name="variety" /> She also starred as the heroine in the horror film ''Along Came the Devil''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Murray|first1=Noel|url=https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|title=Review: Mismatched pieces of exorcism thriller 'Along Came the Devil' don't fit|work=[[Los Angeles Times]]|date=August 9, 2018|accessdate=September 12, 2020|archive-date=January 16, 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210116161036/https://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/la-et-mn-capsule-along-came-the-devil-review-20180809-story.html|url-status=live}}</ref> The next year, Sweeney appeared in the drama film ''[[Clementine (2019 film)|Clementine]]'', the coming-of-age film ''[[Big Time Adolescence]]'', and [[Quentin Tarantino]]'s dramedy ''[[Once Upon a Time in Hollywood]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://deadline.com/2017/10/startups-otmara-marrero-sydney-sweeney-clementine-movie-1202182597/ |title='StartUp's Otmara Marrero, Sydney Sweeney & More Cast In 'Clementine' |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |date=October 5, 2017 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=February 20, 2018 |archive-date=February 12, 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210212084632/https://deadline.com/2017/10/startups-otmara-marrero-sydney-sweeney-clementine-movie-1202182597/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://deadline.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-sydney-sweeney-machine-gun-kelly-big-time-adolescence-american-high-1202417478/ |title=Pete Davidson, Sydney Sweeney, Machine Gun Kelly & More Join 'Big Time Adolescence' From American High |last=N'Duka |first=Amanda |date=June 26, 2018 |work=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |accessdate=June 26, 2018 |archive-date=June 27, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180627033953/https://deadline.com/2018/06/pete-davidson-sydney-sweeney-machine-gun-kelly-big-time-adolescence-american-high-1202417478/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/danny-strong-sydney-sweeney-join-once-a-time-hollywood-1129521 |title=Danny Strong, Sydney Sweeney Join 'Once Upon a Time in Hollywood' (Exclusive) |last=Galuppo |first=Mia |date=August 27, 2018 |magazine=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |accessdate=June 25, 2019 |archive-date=August 28, 2018 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180828035848/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/danny-strong-sydney-sweeney-join-once-a-time-hollywood-1129521 |url-status=live }}</ref>

===2019{{ndash}}present: Breakthrough and mainstream recognition===
Since 2019, Sweeney has portrayed teenager [[List of Euphoria characters#Cassandra "Cassie" Howard|Cassie Howard]] in the drama series ''[[Euphoria (American TV series)|Euphoria]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last1=Chuba|first1=Kirsten|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|title='Euphoria' Star Sydney Sweeney on Tackling Teen Pregnancy, Abortion Discussions|website=[[The Hollywood Reporter]]|date=July 29, 2019|accessdate=September 12, 2020|archive-date=July 30, 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190730013116/https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/euphoria-star-sydney-sweeney-tackling-teen-pregnancy-abortion-discussions-1227536|url-status=live}}</ref> to widespread acclaim, receiving a nomination for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Drama Series]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]]. She starred in the TV film ''[[Nocturne (2020 film)|Nocturne]]'' in 2020.<ref>{{Cite magazine|url=https://deadline.com/2019/09/sydney-sweeney-madison-iseman-nocturne-cast-blumhouse-amazon-studios-movie-1202748475/|title='Nocturne': 'Euphoria's Sydney Sweeney & 'Annabelle 3's Madison Iseman To Star In First Title In Blumhouse TV-Amazon Deal|last=D'Alessandro|first=Anthony|date=September 30, 2019|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|access-date=September 30, 2019|archive-date=December 26, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201226211610/https://deadline.com/2019/09/sydney-sweeney-madison-iseman-nocturne-cast-blumhouse-amazon-studios-movie-1202748475/|url-status=live}}</ref> In 2021, Sweeney appeared in the first season of [[Mike White (filmmaker)|Mike White]]'s anthology black comedy series ''[[The White Lotus]]'',<ref>{{cite web|last1=White|first1=Peter|url=https://deadline.com/2020/10/hbo-the-white-lotus-enlighteneds-mike-white-connie-britton-alexandra-daddario-natasha-rothwell-sydney-sweeney-1234599772/|title='Enlightened's Mike White Sets Limited Social Satire 'The White Lotus' At HBO With Connie Britton, Natasha Rothwell & Sydney Sweeney Among Cast|website=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|date=October 19, 2020|accessdate=February 15, 2021|archive-date=October 19, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20201019200621/https://deadline.com/2020/10/hbo-the-white-lotus-enlighteneds-mike-white-connie-britton-alexandra-daddario-natasha-rothwell-sydney-sweeney-1234599772/|url-status=live}}</ref> receiving critical acclaim for the role. She was nominated for the [[Primetime Emmy Award for Outstanding Supporting Actress in a Limited or Anthology Series or Movie]] in [[74th Primetime Emmy Awards|2022]]. Her accomplishments earned her a place on the [[Time_100#Time_100_Next_list|''Time'' 100 Next list]] for 2022.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Apatow|first1=Maude|url=https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|title=Sydney Sweeney|magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]|date=September 28, 2022|accessdate=October 2, 2022|archive-date=September 28, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220930083008/https://time.com/collection/time100-next-2022/6213734/sydney-sweeney/|url-status=live}}</ref>

Sweeney will next star in the [[superhero film]] ''[[Madame Web (film)|Madame Web]]'', set in the [[Sony's Spider-Man Universe]] (SSU) franchise.<ref name="DD">{{cite web|url=https://deadline.com/2022/03/euphorias-sydney-sweeney-dakota-johnson-sony-marvel-madame-web-1234980232/|title='Euphoria's Sydney Sweeney To Co-Star Opposite Dakota Johnson In Sony's Marvel Pic 'Madame Web'|date=March 16, 2022|publisher=Deadline|access-date=March 17, 2022|archive-date=March 17, 2022|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220317092334/https://deadline.com/2022/03/euphorias-sydney-sweeney-dakota-johnson-sony-marvel-madame-web-1234980232/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref name="SS">{{Cite web |last=Barraclough |first=Leo |date=April 2, 2022 |title=Sydney Sweeney on Her Favorite 'Euphoria' Meme, Exploring the Dark Side of Cassie and Her Martial Arts Skills |url=https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/sydney-sweeney-interview-euphoria-cassie-the-white-lotus-1235221888 |url-status=live |access-date=April 2, 2022 |website=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |quote=One of the roles she has lined up is in “Madame Web,” a comic-book tentpole set in [the SSU]. Is she reading the comic books the movie is based on? “I am. I’ve been ordering a bunch of comic books,” she says. “There’s a lot to learn. I’ve always been a really big fan of all of the Marvel and Sony Universe movies. I’ve grown up watching them all and I’ve been engulfed in the entire world my entire life, so being able to be a part of that is such an incredible, incredible thing.” |archive-date=April 2, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220402215256/https://variety.com/2022/tv/news/sydney-sweeney-interview-euphoria-cassie-the-white-lotus-1235221888/ }}</ref> 
<!--She is also set for three other films with Sony, an adaptation<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |last2=Kroll |first2=Justin |date=2022-08-29 |title=Sydney Sweeney, Brad Fuller And Sony Developing Adaptation Of ‘The Registration’ |url=https://deadline.com/2022/08/sydney-sweeney-brad-fuller-sony-registration-1235102178/ |access-date=2022-11-26 |website=Deadline |language=en-US}}</ref> of the suspense novel [https://camcatbooks.com/Books/T/The-Registration The Registration] by [https://madisonlawson.com/ Madison Lawson], a remake of the cult film [[Barbarella (film)|Barbarella,]] and a psychological horror film ''Immaculate'' from director Michael Mohan. She is also set to executive produce the former and produce the latter. nd will star in ''The Players Table'', a TV series adaptation of Jessica Goodman's novel ''They Wish They Were Us'' on [[HBO Max]], which Sweeney will also executive-produce with her production company, Fifty-Fifty Films.<ref>{{Cite magazine|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=July 31, 2020|title=Sydney Sweeney To Star In & EP 'Players Table' Series For Jean-Marc Vallée & Nathan Ross As She Launches Production Company|url=https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/|access-date=August 1, 2020|magazine=[[Deadline Hollywood]]|archive-date=August 1, 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200801230955/https://deadline.com/2020/07/sydney-sweeney-star-ep-the-players-table-series-jean-marc-vallee-nathan-ross-as-she-launches-production-company-fifty-fifty-films-1203000310/|url-status=live}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|last=Andreeva|first=Nellie|date=2021-02-11|title='The Players Table' Starring Sydney Sweeney & Halsey Lands At HBO Max For Series Development|url=https://deadline.com/2021/02/the-players-table-sydney-sweeney-halsey-hbo-max-crazyrose-endeavor-content-1234692374/|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210211200255/https://deadline.com/2021/02/the-players-table-sydney-sweeney-halsey-hbo-max-crazyrose-endeavor-content-1234692374/|archive-date=February 11, 2021|access-date=2021-02-11|website=Deadline|language=en-US}}</ref> In 2022, it was also announced that she will executive-produce suspense movie, [https://camcatbooks.com/Books/T/The-Registration The Registration], based on the novel by the same name written by [https://madisonlawson.com/ Madison Lawson], with her production company, Fifty-Fifty Films, alongside [[Brad Fuller (producer)|Bradley Fuller]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kroll |first=Justin |last2=Kroll |first2=Justin |date=2022-08-29 |title=Sydney Sweeney, Brad Fuller And Sony Developing Adaptation Of ‘The Registration’ |url=https://deadline.com/2022/08/sydney-sweeney-brad-fuller-sony-registration-1235102178/ |access-date=2022-11-26 |website=Deadline |language=en-US}}</ref>-->
